skill.author: DarkiT

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown guides for the Darkit Gin web framework. All 799 static findings are false positives caused by markdown code blocks using backticks (misidentified as shell execution), Go code examples showing standard JWT/cryptographic patterns in documentation, and example database connection strings in tutorials. No executable code exists in this skill.

content.user_title: Build Enterprise Go APIs with Enhanced Gin Framework
content.value_statement: Building production-ready Go APIs requires extensive boilerplate for authentication, caching, and documentation. This skill teaches you to use Darkit Gin's ready-to-use components for faster development.
actual_capabilities: Configure JWT authentication with token creation, validation, and refresh
Implement SSE real-time communication with client management
Set up caching systems with TTL and automatic cleanup
Generate OpenAPI 3.0 documentation with Swagger UI
Apply middleware patterns for logging, CORS, and rate limiting
Use unified response formats for consistent API design
limitations: Documentation is primarily in Chinese language
Examples assume familiarity with gin-gonic/gin basics
No direct code execution - documentation and guidance only

use_cases.title: Build Production REST APIs
use_cases.description: Create enterprise-grade RESTful APIs with built-in authentication, caching, and automatic documentation generation using Darkit Gin patterns.

use_cases.title: Implement Real-time Features
use_cases.description: Add Server-Sent Events to existing Go applications for live notifications, chat systems, or real-time dashboards.

use_cases.title: Migrate from Gin to Enhanced Framework
use_cases.description: Upgrade existing gin-gonic/gin projects to Darkit Gin for unified responses, built-in JWT, and automatic OpenAPI specs.

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Setup
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a new Go API project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Go API using darkit/gin with JWT authentication, rate limiting, and health check endpoints.

prompt_templates.title: JWT Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement login, token refresh, and role-based access control using darkit/gin JWT features.

prompt_templates.title: SSE Real-time
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me implement Server-Sent Events for real-time notifications using darkit/gin SSE hub with client management.

prompt_templates.title: Full API Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a complete user management API with darkit/gin including CRUD operations, pagination, caching, validation, and OpenAPI documentation.

output_examples.input: How do I create a JWT token in darkit/gin?
output: Use CreateJWTSession method on the context
Provide secret key, expiration duration, and payload data
Store user_id, username, and role in the payload
Return token to client with expires_in field

output_examples.input: How do I set up caching?
output: Use gin.WithCache() option when creating router
Access cache with c.GetCache() in handlers
Use SetWithTTL for custom expiration per item

best_practices: Read JWT secrets from environment variables, never hardcode in source code
Use specific domain allowlists for CORS in production instead of wildcard
Apply rate limiting middleware to protect against abuse
anti_patterns: Using c.JSON() directly instead of unified response methods like c.Success()
Forgetting to clear cache after updating or deleting data
Creating JWT tokens without setting proper expiration times

faq.question: What Go version is required?
faq.answer: Go 1.23 or higher is required. The framework uses modern Go features including generics for type-safe API definitions.

faq.question: Can I migrate from standard gin-gonic/gin?
faq.answer: Yes, darkit/gin is fully compatible with gin-gonic/gin. You can gradually adopt enhanced features while keeping existing code.

faq.question: How does SSE differ from WebSockets?
faq.answer: SSE is server-to-client only, simpler to implement, and works over standard HTTP. Use WebSockets when you need bidirectional communication.

faq.question: Is the documentation available in English?
faq.answer: The primary documentation is in Chinese. Code examples and API method names are in English for universal understanding.

faq.question: How do I generate OpenAPI documentation?
faq.answer: Use gin.WithOpenAPI() option and add annotations like gin.Summary(), gin.PathParam(), and gin.Response() to routes.

faq.question: What caching backends are supported?
faq.answer: The built-in cache uses an in-memory store with automatic cleanup. Configure TTL and cleanup interval through cache.Config.
